16#define TRACE_STREAMING(...) \
17 do { \
18 if (v8_flags.trace_wasm_streaming) PrintF(__VA_ARGS__); \
19 } while (false)
20
21namespace v8 {
22namespace internal {
23namespace wasm {
24
25class V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE AsyncStreamingDecoder : public StreamingDecoder {
26 public:
27 explicit AsyncStreamingDecoder(std::unique_ptr<StreamingProcessor> processor);
28 AsyncStreamingDecoder(const AsyncStreamingDecoder&) = delete;
29 AsyncStreamingDecoder& operator=(const AsyncStreamingDecoder&) = delete;
30
31 void OnBytesReceived(base::Vector<const uint8_t> bytes) override;
32
33 void Finish(bool can_use_compiled_module) override;
34
35 void Abort() override;
36
37 void NotifyCompilationDiscarded() override {
38 auto& active_processor = processor_ ? processor_ : failed_processor_;
39 active_processor.reset();
40 DCHECK_NULL(processor_);
41 DCHECK_NULL(failed_processor_);
42 }
43
44 void NotifyNativeModuleCreated(
45 const std::shared_ptr<NativeModule>& native_module) override;
46
47 private:
48 // The SectionBuffer is the data object for the content of a single section.
49 // It stores all bytes of the section (including section id and section
50 // length), and the offset where the actual payload starts.
51 class SectionBuffer : public WireBytesStorage {
52 public:
53 // id: The section id.
54 // payload_length: The length of the payload.
55 // length_bytes: The section length, as it is encoded in the module bytes.
56 SectionBuffer(uint32_t module_offset, uint8_t id, size_t payload_length,
57 base::Vector<const uint8_t> length_bytes)
58 : // ID + length + payload
59 module_offset_(module_offset),
60 bytes_(base::OwnedVector<uint8_t>::NewForOverwrite(
61 1 + length_bytes.length() + payload_length)),
62 payload_offset_(1 + length_bytes.length()) {
63 bytes_.begin()[0] = id;
64 memcpy(bytes_.begin() + 1, &length_bytes.first(), length_bytes.length());
65 }
66
67 SectionCode section_code() const {
68 return static_cast<SectionCode>(bytes_.begin()[0]);
69 }
70
71 base::Vector<const uint8_t> GetCode(WireBytesRef ref) const final {
72 DCHECK_LE(module_offset_, ref.offset());
73 uint32_t offset_in_code_buffer = ref.offset() - module_offset_;
74 return bytes().SubVector(offset_in_code_buffer,
75 offset_in_code_buffer + ref.length());
76 }
77
78 base::Optional<ModuleWireBytes> GetModuleBytes() const final { return {}; }
79
80 uint32_t module_offset() const { return module_offset_; }
81 base::Vector<uint8_t> bytes() const { return bytes_.as_vector(); }
82 base::Vector<uint8_t> payload() const { return bytes() + payload_offset_; }
83 size_t length() const { return bytes_.size(); }
84 size_t payload_offset() const { return payload_offset_; }
85
86 private:
87 const uint32_t module_offset_;
88 const base::OwnedVector<uint8_t> bytes_;
89 const size_t payload_offset_;
90 };
91
92 // The decoding of a stream of wasm module bytes is organized in states. Each
93 // state provides a buffer to store the bytes required for the current state,
94 // information on how many bytes have already been received, how many bytes
95 // are needed, and a {Next} function which starts the next state once all
96 // bytes of the current state were received.
97 //
98 // The states change according to the following state diagram:
99 //
100 // Start
101 // |
102 // |
103 // v
104 // DecodeModuleHeader
105 // | _________________________________________
106 // | | |
107 // v v |
108 // DecodeSectionID --> DecodeSectionLength --> DecodeSectionPayload
109 // A |
110 // | | (if the section id == code)
111 // | v
112 // | DecodeNumberOfFunctions -- > DecodeFunctionLength
113 // | A |
114 // | | |
115 // | (after all functions were read) | v
116 // ------------------------------------- DecodeFunctionBody
117 //
118 class DecodingState {
119 public:
120 virtual ~DecodingState() = default;
121
122 // Reads the bytes for the current state and returns the number of read
123 // bytes.
124 virtual size_t ReadBytes(AsyncStreamingDecoder* streaming,
125 base::Vector<const uint8_t> bytes);
126
127 // Returns the next state of the streaming decoding.
128 virtual std::unique_ptr<DecodingState> Next(
129 AsyncStreamingDecoder* streaming) = 0;
130 // The buffer to store the received bytes.
131 virtual base::Vector<uint8_t> buffer() = 0;
132 // The number of bytes which were already received.
133 size_t offset() const { return offset_; }
134 void set_offset(size_t value) { offset_ = value; }
135 // A flag to indicate if finishing the streaming decoder is allowed without
136 // error.
137 virtual bool is_finishing_allowed() const { return false; }
138
139 private:
140 size_t offset_ = 0;
141 };
142
143 // Forward declarations of the concrete states. This is needed so that they
144 // can access private members of the AsyncStreamingDecoder.
145 class DecodeVarInt32;
146 class DecodeModuleHeader;
147 class DecodeSectionID;
148 class DecodeSectionLength;
149 class DecodeSectionPayload;
150 class DecodeNumberOfFunctions;
151 class DecodeFunctionLength;
152 class DecodeFunctionBody;
153
154 // Creates a buffer for the next section of the module.
155 SectionBuffer* CreateNewBuffer(uint32_t module_offset, uint8_t section_id,
156 size_t length,
157 base::Vector<const uint8_t> length_bytes);
158
159 std::unique_ptr<DecodingState> ToErrorState() {
160 Fail();
161 return nullptr;
162 }
163
164 void ProcessModuleHeader() {
165 if (!ok()) return;
166 if (!processor_->ProcessModuleHeader(state_->buffer())) Fail();
167 }
168
169 void ProcessSection(SectionBuffer* buffer) {
170 if (!ok()) return;
171 if (!processor_->ProcessSection(
172 buffer->section_code(), buffer->payload(),
173 buffer->module_offset() +
174 static_cast<uint32_t>(buffer->payload_offset()))) {
175 Fail();
176 }
177 }
178
179 void StartCodeSection(int num_functions,
180 std::shared_ptr<WireBytesStorage> wire_bytes_storage,
181 int code_section_start, int code_section_length) {
182 if (!ok()) return;
183 // The offset passed to {ProcessCodeSectionHeader} is an error offset and
184 // not the start offset of a buffer. Therefore we need the -1 here.
185 if (!processor_->ProcessCodeSectionHeader(
186 num_functions, module_offset() - 1, std::move(wire_bytes_storage),
187 code_section_start, code_section_length)) {
188 Fail();
189 }
190 }
191
192 void ProcessFunctionBody(base::Vector<const uint8_t> bytes,
193 uint32_t module_offset) {
194 if (!ok()) return;
195 if (!processor_->ProcessFunctionBody(bytes, module_offset)) Fail();
196 }
197
198 void Fail() {
199 // {Fail} cannot be called after {Finish}, {Abort}, {Fail}, or
200 // {NotifyCompilationDiscarded}.
201 DCHECK_EQ(processor_ == nullptr, failed_processor_ != nullptr);
202 if (processor_ != nullptr) failed_processor_ = std::move(processor_);
203 DCHECK_NULL(processor_);
204 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(failed_processor_);
205 }
206
207 bool ok() const {
208 DCHECK_EQ(processor_ == nullptr, failed_processor_ != nullptr);
209 return processor_ != nullptr;
210 }
211
212 uint32_t module_offset() const { return module_offset_; }
213
214 // As long as we did not detect an invalid module, {processor_} will be set.
215 // On failure, the pointer is transferred to {failed_processor_} and will only
216 // be used for a final callback once all bytes have arrived. Finally, both
217 // {processor_} and {failed_processor_} will be null.
218 std::unique_ptr<StreamingProcessor> processor_;
219 std::unique_ptr<StreamingProcessor> failed_processor_;
220 std::unique_ptr<DecodingState> state_;
221 std::vector<std::shared_ptr<SectionBuffer>> section_buffers_;
222 bool code_section_processed_ = false;
223 uint32_t module_offset_ = 0;
224
225 // Store the full wire bytes in a vector of vectors to avoid having to grow
226 // large vectors (measured up to 100ms delay in 2023-03).
227 // TODO(clemensb): Avoid holding the wire bytes live twice (here and in the
228 // section buffers).
229 std::vector<std::vector<uint8_t>> full_wire_bytes_{{}};
230};
231
232void AsyncStreamingDecoder::OnBytesReceived(base::Vector<const uint8_t> bytes) {
233 DCHECK(!full_wire_bytes_.empty());
234 // Fill the previous vector, growing up to 16kB. After that, allocate new
235 // vectors on overflow.
236 size_t remaining_capacity =
237 std::max(full_wire_bytes_.back().capacity(), size_t{16} * KB) -
238 full_wire_bytes_.back().size();
239 size_t bytes_for_existing_vector = std::min(remaining_capacity, bytes.size());
240 full_wire_bytes_.back().insert(full_wire_bytes_.back().end(), bytes.data(),
241 bytes.data() + bytes_for_existing_vector);
242 if (bytes.size() > bytes_for_existing_vector) {
243 // The previous vector's capacity is not enough to hold all new bytes, and
244 // it's bigger than 16kB, so expensive to copy. Allocate a new vector for
245 // the remaining bytes, growing exponentially.
246 size_t new_capacity = std::max(bytes.size() - bytes_for_existing_vector,
247 2 * full_wire_bytes_.back().capacity());
248 full_wire_bytes_.emplace_back();
249 full_wire_bytes_.back().reserve(new_capacity);
250 full_wire_bytes_.back().insert(full_wire_bytes_.back().end(),
251 bytes.data() + bytes_for_existing_vector,
252 bytes.end());
253 }
254
255 if (deserializing()) return;
256
257 TRACE_STREAMING("OnBytesReceived(%zu bytes)\n", bytes.size());
258
259 size_t current = 0;
260 while (ok() && current < bytes.size()) {
261 size_t num_bytes =
262 state_->ReadBytes(this, bytes.SubVector(current, bytes.size()));
263 current += num_bytes;
264 module_offset_ += num_bytes;
265 if (state_->offset() == state_->buffer().size()) {
266 state_ = state_->Next(this);
267 }
268 }
269 if (ok()) {
270 processor_->OnFinishedChunk();
271 }
272}
273
274size_t AsyncStreamingDecoder::DecodingState::ReadBytes(
275 AsyncStreamingDecoder* streaming, base::Vector<const uint8_t> bytes) {
276 base::Vector<uint8_t> remaining_buf = buffer() + offset();
277 size_t num_bytes = std::min(bytes.size(), remaining_buf.size());
278 TRACE_STREAMING("ReadBytes(%zu bytes)\n", num_bytes);
279 memcpy(remaining_buf.begin(), &bytes.first(), num_bytes);
280 set_offset(offset() + num_bytes);
281 return num_bytes;
282}
283
284void AsyncStreamingDecoder::Finish(bool can_use_compiled_module) {
285 TRACE_STREAMING("Finish\n");
286 // {Finish} cannot be called after {Finish}, {Abort}, {Fail}, or
287 // {NotifyCompilationDiscarded}.
288 CHECK_EQ(processor_ == nullptr, failed_processor_ != nullptr);
289
290 // Create a final copy of the overall wire bytes; this will finally be
291 // transferred and stored in the NativeModule.
292 base::OwnedVector<const uint8_t> bytes_copy;
293 DCHECK_IMPLIES(full_wire_bytes_.back().empty(), full_wire_bytes_.size() == 1);
294 if (!full_wire_bytes_.back().empty()) {
295 size_t total_length = 0;
296 for (auto& bytes : full_wire_bytes_) total_length += bytes.size();
297 auto all_bytes = base::OwnedVector<uint8_t>::NewForOverwrite(total_length);
298 uint8_t* ptr = all_bytes.begin();
299 for (auto& bytes : full_wire_bytes_) {
300 memcpy(ptr, bytes.data(), bytes.size());
301 ptr += bytes.size();
302 }
303 DCHECK_EQ(all_bytes.end(), ptr);
304 bytes_copy = std::move(all_bytes);
305 }
306
307 if (ok() && deserializing()) {
308 // Try to deserialize the module from wire bytes and module bytes.
309 if (can_use_compiled_module &&
310 processor_->Deserialize(compiled_module_bytes_,
311 base::VectorOf(bytes_copy))) {
312 return;
313 }
314
315 // Compiled module bytes are invalidated by can_use_compiled_module = false
316 // or the deserialization failed. Restart decoding using |bytes_copy|.
317 // Reset {full_wire_bytes} to a single empty vector.
318 full_wire_bytes_.assign({{}});
319 compiled_module_bytes_ = {};
320 DCHECK(!deserializing());
321 OnBytesReceived(base::VectorOf(bytes_copy));
322 // The decoder has received all wire bytes; fall through and finish.
323 }
324
325 if (ok() && !state_->is_finishing_allowed()) {
326 // The byte stream ended too early, we report an error.
327 Fail();
328 }
329
330 // Calling {OnFinishedStream} calls out to JS. Avoid further callbacks (by
331 // aborting the stream) by resetting the processor field before calling
332 // {OnFinishedStream}.
333 const bool failed = !ok();
334 std::unique_ptr<StreamingProcessor> processor =
335 failed ? std::move(failed_processor_) : std::move(processor_);
336 processor->OnFinishedStream(std::move(bytes_copy), failed);
337}
338
339void AsyncStreamingDecoder::Abort() {
340 TRACE_STREAMING("Abort\n");
341 // Ignore {Abort} after {Finish}.
342 if (!processor_ && !failed_processor_) return;
343 Fail();
344 failed_processor_->OnAbort();
345 failed_processor_.reset();
346}
347
348namespace {
349
350class CallMoreFunctionsCanBeSerializedCallback
351 : public CompilationEventCallback {
352 public:
353 CallMoreFunctionsCanBeSerializedCallback(
354 std::weak_ptr<NativeModule> native_module,
355 AsyncStreamingDecoder::MoreFunctionsCanBeSerializedCallback callback)
356 : native_module_(std::move(native_module)),
357 callback_(std::move(callback)) {
358 // As a baseline we also count the modules that could be cached but
359 // never reach the threshold.
360 if (std::shared_ptr<NativeModule> module = native_module_.lock()) {
361 module->counters()->wasm_cache_count()->AddSample(0);
362 }
363 }
364
365 void call(CompilationEvent event) override {
366 if (event != CompilationEvent::kFinishedCompilationChunk) return;
367 // If the native module is still alive, get back a shared ptr and call the
368 // callback.
369 if (std::shared_ptr<NativeModule> native_module = native_module_.lock()) {
370 native_module->counters()->wasm_cache_count()->AddSample(++cache_count_);
371 callback_(native_module);
372 }
373 }
374
375 ReleaseAfterFinalEvent release_after_final_event() override {
376 return kKeepAfterFinalEvent;
377 }
378
379 private:
380 const std::weak_ptr<NativeModule> native_module_;
381 const AsyncStreamingDecoder::MoreFunctionsCanBeSerializedCallback callback_;
382 int cache_count_ = 0;
383};
384
385} // namespace
386
387void AsyncStreamingDecoder::NotifyNativeModuleCreated(
388 const std::shared_ptr<NativeModule>& native_module) {
389 if (!more_functions_can_be_serialized_callback_) return;
390 auto* comp_state = native_module->compilation_state();
391
392 comp_state->AddCallback(
393 std::make_unique<CallMoreFunctionsCanBeSerializedCallback>(
394 native_module,
395 std::move(more_functions_can_be_serialized_callback_)));
396 more_functions_can_be_serialized_callback_ = {};
397}
398
399// An abstract class to share code among the states which decode VarInts. This
400// class takes over the decoding of the VarInt and then calls the actual decode
401// code with the decoded value.
402class AsyncStreamingDecoder::DecodeVarInt32 : public DecodingState {
403 public:
404 explicit DecodeVarInt32(size_t max_value, const char* field_name)
405 : max_value_(max_value), field_name_(field_name) {}
406
407 base::Vector<uint8_t> buffer() override {
408 return base::ArrayVector(byte_buffer_);
409 }
410
411 size_t ReadBytes(AsyncStreamingDecoder* streaming,
412 base::Vector<const uint8_t> bytes) override;
413
414 std::unique_ptr<DecodingState> Next(
415 AsyncStreamingDecoder* streaming) override;
416
417 virtual std::unique_ptr<DecodingState> NextWithValue(
418 AsyncStreamingDecoder* streaming) = 0;
419
420 protected:
421 uint8_t byte_buffer_[kMaxVarInt32Size];
422 // The maximum valid value decoded in this state. {Next} returns an error if
423 // this value is exceeded.
424 const size_t max_value_;
425 const char* const field_name_;
426 size_t value_ = 0;
427 size_t bytes_consumed_ = 0;
428};
429
430class AsyncStreamingDecoder::DecodeModuleHeader : public DecodingState {
431 public:
432 base::Vector<uint8_t> buffer() override {
433 return base::ArrayVector(byte_buffer_);
434 }
435
436 std::unique_ptr<DecodingState> Next(
437 AsyncStreamingDecoder* streaming) override;
438
439 private:
440 // Checks if the magic bytes of the module header are correct.
441 void CheckHeader(Decoder* decoder);
442
443 // The size of the module header.
444 static constexpr size_t kModuleHeaderSize = 8;
445 uint8_t byte_buffer_[kModuleHeaderSize];
446};
447
448class AsyncStreamingDecoder::DecodeSectionID : public DecodingState {
449 public:
450 explicit DecodeSectionID(uint32_t module_offset)
451 : module_offset_(module_offset) {}
452
453 base::Vector<uint8_t> buffer() override { return {&id_, 1}; }
454 bool is_finishing_allowed() const override { return true; }
455
456 std::unique_ptr<DecodingState> Next(
457 AsyncStreamingDecoder* streaming) override;
458
459 private:
460 uint8_t id_ = 0;
461 // The start offset of this section in the module.
462 const uint32_t module_offset_;
463};
464
465class AsyncStreamingDecoder::DecodeSectionLength : public DecodeVarInt32 {
466 public:
467 explicit DecodeSectionLength(uint8_t id, uint32_t module_offset)
468 : DecodeVarInt32(max_module_size(), "section length"),
469 section_id_(id),
470 module_offset_(module_offset) {}
471
472 std::unique_ptr<DecodingState> NextWithValue(
473 AsyncStreamingDecoder* streaming) override;
474
475 private:
476 const uint8_t section_id_;
477 // The start offset of this section in the module.
478 const uint32_t module_offset_;
479};
480
481class AsyncStreamingDecoder::DecodeSectionPayload : public DecodingState {
482 public:
483 explicit DecodeSectionPayload(SectionBuffer* section_buffer)
484 : section_buffer_(section_buffer) {}
485
486 base::Vector<uint8_t> buffer() override { return section_buffer_->payload(); }
487
488 std::unique_ptr<DecodingState> Next(
489 AsyncStreamingDecoder* streaming) override;
490
491 private:
492 SectionBuffer* const section_buffer_;
493};
494
495class AsyncStreamingDecoder::DecodeNumberOfFunctions : public DecodeVarInt32 {
496 public:
497 explicit DecodeNumberOfFunctions(SectionBuffer* section_buffer)
498 : DecodeVarInt32(v8_flags.max_wasm_functions, "functions count"),
499 section_buffer_(section_buffer) {}
500
501 std::unique_ptr<DecodingState> NextWithValue(
502 AsyncStreamingDecoder* streaming) override;
503
504 private:
505 SectionBuffer* const section_buffer_;
506};
507
508class AsyncStreamingDecoder::DecodeFunctionLength : public DecodeVarInt32 {
509 public:
510 explicit DecodeFunctionLength(SectionBuffer* section_buffer,
511 size_t buffer_offset,
512 size_t num_remaining_functions)
513 : DecodeVarInt32(kV8MaxWasmFunctionSize, "function body size"),
514 section_buffer_(section_buffer),
515 buffer_offset_(buffer_offset),
516 // We are reading a new function, so one function less is remaining.
517 num_remaining_functions_(num_remaining_functions - 1) {
518 DCHECK_GT(num_remaining_functions, 0);
519 }
520
521 std::unique_ptr<DecodingState> NextWithValue(
522 AsyncStreamingDecoder* streaming) override;
523
524 private:
525 SectionBuffer* const section_buffer_;
526 const size_t buffer_offset_;
527 const size_t num_remaining_functions_;
528};
529
530class AsyncStreamingDecoder::DecodeFunctionBody : public DecodingState {
531 public:
532 explicit DecodeFunctionBody(SectionBuffer* section_buffer,
533 size_t buffer_offset, size_t function_body_length,
534 size_t num_remaining_functions,
535 uint32_t module_offset)
536 : section_buffer_(section_buffer),
537 buffer_offset_(buffer_offset),
538 function_body_length_(function_body_length),
539 num_remaining_functions_(num_remaining_functions),
540 module_offset_(module_offset) {}
541
542 base::Vector<uint8_t> buffer() override {
543 base::Vector<uint8_t> remaining_buffer =
544 section_buffer_->bytes() + buffer_offset_;
545 return remaining_buffer.SubVector(0, function_body_length_);
546 }
547
548 std::unique_ptr<DecodingState> Next(
549 AsyncStreamingDecoder* streaming) override;
550
551 private:
552 SectionBuffer* const section_buffer_;
553 const size_t buffer_offset_;
554 const size_t function_body_length_;
555 const size_t num_remaining_functions_;
556 const uint32_t module_offset_;
557};
558
559size_t AsyncStreamingDecoder::DecodeVarInt32::ReadBytes(
560 AsyncStreamingDecoder* streaming, base::Vector<const uint8_t> bytes) {
561 base::Vector<uint8_t> buf = buffer();
562 base::Vector<uint8_t> remaining_buf = buf + offset();
563 size_t new_bytes = std::min(bytes.size(), remaining_buf.size());
564 TRACE_STREAMING("ReadBytes of a VarInt\n");
565 memcpy(remaining_buf.begin(), &bytes.first(), new_bytes);
566 buf.Truncate(offset() + new_bytes);
567 Decoder decoder(buf,
568 streaming->module_offset() - static_cast<uint32_t>(offset()));
569 value_ = decoder.consume_u32v(field_name_);
570
571 if (decoder.failed()) {
572 if (new_bytes == remaining_buf.size()) {
573 // We only report an error if we read all bytes.
574 streaming->Fail();
575 }
576 set_offset(offset() + new_bytes);
577 return new_bytes;
578 }
579
580 // The number of bytes we actually needed to read.
581 DCHECK_GT(decoder.pc(), buffer().begin());
582 bytes_consumed_ = static_cast<size_t>(decoder.pc() - buf.begin());
583 TRACE_STREAMING(" ==> %zu bytes consumed\n", bytes_consumed_);
584
585 // We read all the bytes we needed.
586 DCHECK_GT(bytes_consumed_, offset());
587 new_bytes = bytes_consumed_ - offset();
588 // Set the offset to the buffer size to signal that we are at the end of this
589 // section.
590 set_offset(buffer().size());
591 return new_bytes;
592}
593
594std::unique_ptr<AsyncStreamingDecoder::DecodingState>
595AsyncStreamingDecoder::DecodeVarInt32::Next(AsyncStreamingDecoder* streaming) {
596 if (!streaming->ok()) return nullptr;
597
598 if (value_ > max_value_) return streaming->ToErrorState();
599
600 return NextWithValue(streaming);
601}
602
603std::unique_ptr<AsyncStreamingDecoder::DecodingState>
604AsyncStreamingDecoder::DecodeModuleHeader::Next(
605 AsyncStreamingDecoder* streaming) {
606 TRACE_STREAMING("DecodeModuleHeader\n");
607 streaming->ProcessModuleHeader();
608 if (!streaming->ok()) return nullptr;
609 return std::make_unique<DecodeSectionID>(streaming->module_offset());
610}
611
612std::unique_ptr<AsyncStreamingDecoder::DecodingState>
613AsyncStreamingDecoder::DecodeSectionID::Next(AsyncStreamingDecoder* streaming) {
614 TRACE_STREAMING("DecodeSectionID: %u (%s)\n", id_,
615 SectionName(static_cast<SectionCode>(id_)));
616 if (!IsValidSectionCode(id_)) return streaming->ToErrorState();
617 if (id_ == SectionCode::kCodeSectionCode) {
618 // Explicitly check for multiple code sections as module decoder never
619 // sees the code section and hence cannot track this section.
620 if (streaming->code_section_processed_) return streaming->ToErrorState();
621 streaming->code_section_processed_ = true;
622 }
623 return std::make_unique<DecodeSectionLength>(id_, module_offset_);
624}
625
626std::unique_ptr<AsyncStreamingDecoder::DecodingState>
627AsyncStreamingDecoder::DecodeSectionLength::NextWithValue(
628 AsyncStreamingDecoder* streaming) {
629 TRACE_STREAMING("DecodeSectionLength(%zu)\n", value_);
630 SectionBuffer* buf =
631 streaming->CreateNewBuffer(module_offset_, section_id_, value_,
632 buffer().SubVector(0, bytes_consumed_));
633 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(buf);
634 if (value_ == 0) {
635 if (section_id_ == SectionCode::kCodeSectionCode) {
636 return streaming->ToErrorState();
637 }
638 // Process section without payload as well, to enforce section order and
639 // other feature checks specific to each individual section.
640 streaming->ProcessSection(buf);
641 if (!streaming->ok()) return nullptr;
642 // There is no payload, we go to the next section immediately.
643 return std::make_unique<DecodeSectionID>(streaming->module_offset_);
644 }
645 if (section_id_ == SectionCode::kCodeSectionCode) {
646 // We reached the code section. All functions of the code section are put
647 // into the same SectionBuffer.
648 return std::make_unique<DecodeNumberOfFunctions>(buf);
649 }
650 return std::make_unique<DecodeSectionPayload>(buf);
651}
652
653std::unique_ptr<AsyncStreamingDecoder::DecodingState>
654AsyncStreamingDecoder::DecodeSectionPayload::Next(
655 AsyncStreamingDecoder* streaming) {
656 TRACE_STREAMING("DecodeSectionPayload\n");
657 streaming->ProcessSection(section_buffer_);
658 if (!streaming->ok()) return nullptr;
659 return std::make_unique<DecodeSectionID>(streaming->module_offset());
660}
661
662std::unique_ptr<AsyncStreamingDecoder::DecodingState>
663AsyncStreamingDecoder::DecodeNumberOfFunctions::NextWithValue(
664 AsyncStreamingDecoder* streaming) {
665 TRACE_STREAMING("DecodeNumberOfFunctions(%zu)\n", value_);
666 // Copy the bytes we read into the section buffer.
667 base::Vector<uint8_t> payload_buf = section_buffer_->payload();
668 if (payload_buf.size() < bytes_consumed_) return streaming->ToErrorState();
669 memcpy(payload_buf.begin(), buffer().begin(), bytes_consumed_);
670
671 DCHECK_GE(kMaxInt, section_buffer_->module_offset() +
672 section_buffer_->payload_offset());
673 int code_section_start = static_cast<int>(section_buffer_->module_offset() +
674 section_buffer_->payload_offset());
675 DCHECK_GE(kMaxInt, payload_buf.length());
676 int code_section_len = static_cast<int>(payload_buf.length());
677 DCHECK_GE(kMaxInt, value_);
678 streaming->StartCodeSection(static_cast<int>(value_),
679 streaming->section_buffers_.back(),
680 code_section_start, code_section_len);
681 if (!streaming->ok()) return nullptr;
682
683 // {value} is the number of functions.
684 if (value_ == 0) {
685 if (payload_buf.size() != bytes_consumed_) {
686 return streaming->ToErrorState();
687 }
688 return std::make_unique<DecodeSectionID>(streaming->module_offset());
689 }
690
691 return std::make_unique<DecodeFunctionLength>(
692 section_buffer_, section_buffer_->payload_offset() + bytes_consumed_,
693 value_);
694}
695
696std::unique_ptr<AsyncStreamingDecoder::DecodingState>
697AsyncStreamingDecoder::DecodeFunctionLength::NextWithValue(
698 AsyncStreamingDecoder* streaming) {
699 TRACE_STREAMING("DecodeFunctionLength(%zu)\n", value_);
700 // Copy the bytes we consumed into the section buffer.
701 base::Vector<uint8_t> fun_length_buffer =
702 section_buffer_->bytes() + buffer_offset_;
703 if (fun_length_buffer.size() < bytes_consumed_) {
704 return streaming->ToErrorState();
705 }
706 memcpy(fun_length_buffer.begin(), buffer().begin(), bytes_consumed_);
707
708 // {value} is the length of the function.
709 if (value_ == 0) return streaming->ToErrorState();
710
711 if (buffer_offset_ + bytes_consumed_ + value_ > section_buffer_->length()) {
712 return streaming->ToErrorState();
713 }
714
715 return std::make_unique<DecodeFunctionBody>(
716 section_buffer_, buffer_offset_ + bytes_consumed_, value_,
717 num_remaining_functions_, streaming->module_offset());
718}
719
720std::unique_ptr<AsyncStreamingDecoder::DecodingState>
721AsyncStreamingDecoder::DecodeFunctionBody::Next(
722 AsyncStreamingDecoder* streaming) {
723 TRACE_STREAMING("DecodeFunctionBody\n");
724 streaming->ProcessFunctionBody(buffer(), module_offset_);
725 if (!streaming->ok()) return nullptr;
726
727 size_t end_offset = buffer_offset_ + function_body_length_;
728 if (num_remaining_functions_ > 0) {
729 return std::make_unique<DecodeFunctionLength>(section_buffer_, end_offset,
730 num_remaining_functions_);
731 }
732 // We just read the last function body. Continue with the next section.
733 if (end_offset != section_buffer_->length()) {
734 return streaming->ToErrorState();
735 }
736 return std::make_unique<DecodeSectionID>(streaming->module_offset());
737}
738
739AsyncStreamingDecoder::AsyncStreamingDecoder(
740 std::unique_ptr<StreamingProcessor> processor)
741 : processor_(std::move(processor)),
742 // A module always starts with a module header.
743 state_(new DecodeModuleHeader()) {}
744
745AsyncStreamingDecoder::SectionBuffer* AsyncStreamingDecoder::CreateNewBuffer(
746 uint32_t module_offset, uint8_t section_id, size_t length,
747 base::Vector<const uint8_t> length_bytes) {
748 // Section buffers are allocated in the same order they appear in the module,
749 // they will be processed and later on concatenated in that same order.
750 section_buffers_.emplace_back(std::make_shared<SectionBuffer>(
751 module_offset, section_id, length, length_bytes));
752 return section_buffers_.back().get();
753}
754
755std::unique_ptr<StreamingDecoder> StreamingDecoder::CreateAsyncStreamingDecoder(
756 std::unique_ptr<StreamingProcessor> processor) {
757 return std::make_unique<AsyncStreamingDecoder>(std::move(processor));
758}
759
760} // namespace wasm
761} // namespace internal
762} // namespace v8
